comment: Theres a lot of work for her class, but its easy time consuming work. She really cares about her students and really wants them to come out learning something. If youre wanting to be an entrepreneur. Take her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. She's ridiculous, you have to get an A on EVERYTHING IN ORDER TO MAKE AN A IN THE CLASS. SUPER rude and condescending. You have to turn in everything to her for review, get feedback then do it over again and turn it in. Way too much work for an intro to management class. Expects so much but she can't even use correct grammar...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Grades you on material completely unrelated to the course, workload is totally inappropriate. Confusing assignments!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests? Not many

comment: She has the potential to make you feel a little dumb because email responses are so pithy, but that aside, she gives you clear feedback. You woodshed your assignments until she has the product she wants (no rubrics, but feedb). I recommend her over Blumentritt who rations A's in 8999. She will help you get there. Workload is best during summer.

I don't understand  how reviews for this professor are so bad.  You must make an A on every assignment to get an A for the class but  you can submit your assignments as many times as you want before the due date and she will tell you what you got right and what you need to fix. Easy A if you work 2 hr/ week, tough grader but she gives u all answers
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Should be called micromgt. An A is possible but not easy. She likes to talk down to students & over critiques, but if you do EXACTLY what she tells you you'll get an A. Take advantage of early submissions to get feedback. Busy work, really didnt learn much

Gives a lot of work, but not difficult or easy just time consuming.  Very intelligent teacher, but her style is not for everyone.  Key is to keep up with the work.  ICS is brutal and you'll probably hate your company at the end.  Don't miss class.  Book was a joke; KSU mandatory.  Good bit of ppt and group work.

There is a good bit of work in this class, but an A is definitely obtainable. Pay attention in class, and ask questions. Big group project and two big tests in this class. You work on the tests throughout the semester. She lets you submit the tests as you go, and she will tell you what correct. Lot of busy work, but I would take her again!!
Her maymester consist of a lot of work. This class is not an easy A, but an A is possible if you work for it. She is very helpful and gets back with emails very quickly.

I learned to do system models, better power point presentations  and how to improve my graphs and tables.  You have to make good notes during class, mostly for test #1. You will have to work hard, but it is not impossible to get an A.  There are a lot of  group projects in this class.  I would take this instructor again.

Maymester: Lots of work but able to get done. Be sure to give yourself plenty of time after class. Lady rambles on and on about who knows what but there is an A in there somewhere. Be sure to turn in your assignments early and often(she looks over them and tells you what to fix to help your grade). Be ready to get frustrated with her weird grading

EXTREME WORKLOAD!Teacher is brilliant, but does not communicate message well!Poor organization; GAVIEW page is a nightmare.She will list the same thing in 2 to 4 different places with slight variations, and criticize the version you ended up using.Does not let you learn-must use her verbiage in papers. Loss your hair if you are not a mind reader!

We did not learn much from this Capstone course.  In writing assignments, strictly follow her instructions. Also, submitting writing assignments on time is much more important than having a quality writing.  The suggestion for future students is take less courses at the same time.  Warning: EXTREMELY INSANE WORKLOAD!

If you pay attention and do things EXACTLY as she advises, you will get an A. If you derivate in any way, from what she tells you, you will not. My hang up with Professor Brawley is that she did not allow me to learn things in my manner of learning, she grades all written papers based on what she tells you to write and not how you understand it.

This class is a ton of work, but it is definitely worth it. Dr. Brawley cares about the students and is incredibly experienced in entrepreneurship. You will learn a ton, but it is not for everyone because of the sheer amount of work. Highly recommended for all entrepreneurs.
The most work i have ever done in a class by FAR. Although she is very nice and keeps class interesting the work load is just not worth it AT ALL.  RIDICULOUS.

How can anyone not enjoy and learn from this class.  There is a lot of work, but no due dates.  Work can be reviewed and redone, therefore, you are ultimately responsible for your grade.  If you want an 'A', just do the work.  This is one of the best classes I took at KSU (only have 8999 left).  I highly recommend if you want to be an entrepreneur.

If you have any love for yourself, do not take this professor.  There is SO much busy work anf your objectives are not made clear.                                                      She is rude and loves calling people out for the littlest things.  If you come to class late, expect to be embarrassed in front of the entire class. DO NOT TAKE HER!

Ok. You'll think this is an easy class and take it lightly. It not. She is experienced and very knowledgeable and she's trying to get you to that level. Take her lectures seriously, go to class on time, take notes, ask her questions. You will get the grade you work for and deserve.

Prof. Brawley's class was a lot of fun to take. She gives a unique perspective on Strategic Management that allows you to apply it in every situation. Start your projects early so she can give you feedback. You can turn things in every week to make sure you get an A. You have to be a total goof off if you get less than a B in this class.

Great teacher! She really loves what she does and very competent and reliable. I learned a lot but it was a lot of hard work. Be wise about picking team members and start working from day #1. You must make an A on all assignments to get an A out the class. It is important to get her feedback on your work before final submission.
A lot of work but i worked hared and made an A one of my first in a while

Expext a semester long project, and prepare to take it seriously.  Don't be fooled that the lectures seem like casual discussions.  I found these to be very exciting, and that they changed my way of thinking.  Her syllabus was a mess,very hard for me to comprehend what I needed to do.  She also bragged about herself very frequently, poor appearance

Dr. Brawley is well educated and has outstanding credentials.  Very passionate about management with an outstanding teaching methodology. By no means easy, down right stressful at times. I still have nightmares about the work load. I learned a lot and am glad I took the class. A full class load and/or employed?  Be prepared to extend yourself.

If you are a working student this class is not for you.  She gives you more than enough busy work to do.  You do so many group presentations in her class.  Again she is nice but she gives entirely to much work with high expectations.  And you can not miss more than one day in her class or she will drop you from the course.

If you're a management major,definately take her class. Tests are take home and very subjective.Will give extra grades for class participation though. Take pictures for your project presentation, you will get atleast a B

She is a very nice teacher. I have enjoyed the class. Yes, it requered a lot of work, not difficult but time consumming. If you dont like to wright papers and do prentasention do not take this teacher. We had no tests.

This class does not have any tests, but it is ridiculously hard. You have a semester-long group project that is awful. It requires a huge amount of time. The final is basically your semester notes in the form of a newsletter--a lot harder than it sounds. If you like subjective grading, take her. If you like objective grading, DON'T take her class.

There are only 2 tests throughout the sememester. The tests are take home but are extremely hard!! Professor is not very clear when it comes to letting students know what she wants from them. Unless this is the only class you're taking this semester. Do not take her!!!
